entries.name: Ruby
entries.comment: Fell in love with it in my teenage years when I got sick of PHP, it's a daily ever since.

entries.name: JavaScript & TypeScript
entries.comment: Started in the jQuery / Mootools era and followed along the insane rise of this language.

entries.name: Go
entries.comment: A fairly recent discovery, an awesome language to build microservices.

entries.name: Ruby on Rails
entries.comment: Obviously being a Ruby enthusiast. Every single of my job experience was dealing with a Rails monolith.

entries.name: Hanami
entries.comment: I love what they did in version 2, a perfect framework for building small Ruby services.

entries.name: React
entries.comment: In itself a brilliant library, the clutter of hype driven packages surrounding it is unbearable though.

entries.name: Node.js & Express
entries.comment: It used to be a daily, I've built complex services with this two.

entries.name: tailwindcss
entries.comment: All my personal projects includes it, I love tailwind to death.

entries.name: VSCode
entries.comment: I've tried some IDEs but never could get used to it.

entries.name: Docker
entries.comment: I do not miss the times where we had to install everything on our machine and juggle between multiple versions.

entries.name: Redis
entries.comment: Obviously I'm well versed in the classic like psql but I must make a special mention, always a joy to work with.
